main event: A witness in Philomath, Oregon observed a bright yellow, pencil-shaped object for about 5 minutes on April 17, 1966.
interesting points: The object appeared to take off at about a 45-degree angle and moved at an estimated speed of 15 mph.
The object was observed by two witnesses, Alvin Hockema and his wife, from Alsea, Oregon.
The weather conditions at the time were clear, with some fog patches and strong surface winds.
The witness estimated the object could have been covered by about 1/2 to 1 inch of a match stick held at arm's length.
The object's appearance changed from an 'electric arc weld' at takeoff to a 'yellow-white ellipsoid object' during the observation.
